etymology.description: Eye depicting an eye rotated 90 degrees -> 目(目) (mù, 'eye')
etymology.interpretation: 目(目) (mù, 'eye') visually represents a human eye turned to its side, capturing its essential features. This pictorial representation makes the character immediately intuitive as referring to the eye.

examples.chinese: 他的目光锐利(他的目光銳利)。
我看到远处那闪烁的双目(我看到遠處那閃爍的雙目)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ kàn dào yuǎnchù nà shǎnshuò de shuāng mù.
examples.english: I see the twinkling eyes in the distance.

examples.chinese: 当晨曦初露时(當晨曦初露時)，他的目中闪烁着智慧(他的目中閃爍著智慧)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng chénxī chūlù shí, tā de mù zhōng shǎnshuò zhe zhìhuì.
examples.english: When the dawn first appears, wisdom sparkles in his eyes.
